headline.main: Older People Become What They Think, Study Shows

docs.abstract: When older adults view age as a time of wisdom, self-realization and satisfaction, they are more likely to seek preventive medical care and die later, and less likely to suffer memory loss and poor physical functioning, a growing body of research shows.
docs.snippet: When older adults view age as a time of wisdom, self-realization and satisfaction, they are more likely to seek preventive medical care and die later, and less likely to suffer memory loss and poor physical functioning, a growing body of research...

headline.print_headline: Risks: Coffee Linked to Fewer Oral Cancer Deaths
headline.main: Risks: Coffee Linked to Fewer Oral Cancer Deaths

docs.abstract: A large study of 968,432 initially healthy men and women has found that drinking coffee is associated with a reduced risk of death from oral cancers.
docs.snippet: A large study of 968,432 initially healthy men and women has found that drinking coffee is associated with a reduced risk of death from oral cancers.

headline.seo: N.Y.C. Nurses Aid Low-Income First-Time Mothers
headline.main: For Mothers at Risk, Someone to Lean On

docs.abstract: Nurse-Family Partnership, New York City program begun in the 1970s, pairs specially trained nurses with low-income first-time mothers, starting during pregnancy; rigorously tested program has shown consistent benefits for mothers and children, as well as significant savings for taxpayers.
docs.lead_paragraph: A city program pairs nurses with motherhood’s hard cases: some in shelters, others abused, angry, despairing, ill and exhausted.
docs.snippet: A city program pairs nurses with motherhood’s hard cases: some in shelters, others abused, angry, despairing, ill and exhausted.
